add.en: Join (something) to something else so as to increase the size, number, or amount.

air.en: The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.

any.en: Used to refer to one or some of a thing or number of things, no matter how much or many.

ape.en: A large primate that lacks a tail, including the gorilla, chimpanzees, orangutan, and gibbons.

away.en: To or at a distance from a particular place, person, or thing.

barn.en: A large farm building used for storing grain, hay, or straw or for housing livestock.

bay.en: A broad inlet of the sea where the land curves inward.

bunny.en: A child's term for a rabbit.

calf.en: A young bovine animal, especially a domestic cow or bull.

candy.en: A sweet food made with sugar or syrup combined with fruit, chocolate, or nuts.

care.en: The provision of what is necessary for the health, welfare, maintenance, and protection of someone or something.

child.en: A young human being below the age of puberty or below the legal age of majority.

cold.en: Of or at a low or relatively low temperature, especially when compared with the human body.

color.en: The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way it reflects or emits light.

cookie.en: A sweet biscuit having a fairly soft, chewy texture and typically containing pieces of chocolate or fruit.

cow.en: A fully grown female animal of a domesticated breed of ox, kept to produce milk or beef.

cub.en: The young of a fox, bear, lion, or other carnivorous mammal.

day.en: A period of twenty-four hours as a unit of time.

dot.en: A small round mark or spot.

dove.en: A stocky seed- or fruit-eating bird with a small head, short legs, and a cooing voice.

easy.en: Achieved without great effort; presenting few difficulties.

elf.en: A supernatural creature of folk tales, typically represented as a small, elusive figure in human form with pointed ears, magical powers, and a capricious nature.

fall.en: Move downward, typically rapidly and freely without control, from a higher to a lower level.

fly.en: (of a bird, bat, or insect) move through the air using wings.

gum.en: A viscous secretion of some trees and shrubs that hardens on drying but is soluble in water, and from which adhesives and other products are made.

gun.en: A weapon incorporating a metal tube from which bullets, shells, or other missiles are propelled by explosive force.

hay.en: Grass that has been mown and dried for use as fodder.

help.en: Make it easier for (someone) to do something by offering one's services or resources.

here.en: In, at, or to this place or position.

hill.en: A naturally raised area of land, not as high or craggy as a mountain.

hop.en: (of a person) move by jumping on one foot.

lap.en: The flat area between the waist and knees of a seated person.

late.en: Doing something or taking place after the expected, proper, or usual time.

line.en: A long, narrow mark or band.

look.en: Direct one's gaze toward someone or something or in a specified direction.

love.en: An intense feeling of deep affection.

low.en: Of less than average height from top to bottom or to the top from the ground.

more.en: A greater or additional amount or degree.

move.en: Go in a specified direction or manner; change position.

nap.en: Sleep lightly or briefly, especially during the day.

open.en: Allow access, passage, or a view through an empty space; not closed or blocked.

pass.en: Move or cause to move in a specified direction.

pizza.en: A dish of Italian origin consisting of a flat, round base of dough baked with a topping of tomato sauce and cheese, typically with added meat or vegetables.

pony.en: A horse of a small breed, especially one whose height at the withers is below 14 hands 2 inches.

rabbit.en: A burrowing, gregarious, plant-eating mammal with long ears, long hind legs, and a short tail.

rich.en: Having a great deal of money or assets; wealthy.

robot.en: A machine capable of carrying out a complex series of actions automatically, especially one programmable by a computer.

safe.en: Protected from or not exposed to danger or risk; not likely to be harmed or lost.

shy.en: Being reserved or having or showing nervousness or timidity in the company of other people.

sick.en: Affected by physical or mental illness.

stop.en: (of an event, action, or process) come to an end; cease to happen.

wax.en: A sticky yellowish moldable substance secreted by honeybees as the material of honeycomb; beeswax.

zipper.en: A device for fastening clothing or bags, consisting of two rows of metal or plastic teeth that are interlocked by a sliding tab.
